snippet.title: BMW C1 \- Wikipedia
snippet.description: BMW's intention with the C1 was to appeal to car drivers in crowded city streets. However, poor C1 sales in the United Kingdom may in part be attributable to the British government's refusal of BMW's request to change helmet regulations for C1 riders.

snippet.title: BMW C1-E
snippet.description: BMW C1-E: Concept for a higher level of safety in the city. Interesting October 6th, 2009 by Horatiu Boeriu. This is what a safe, environment-friendly and highly practical single track vehicle for city traffic could look like in the future BMW Motorrad developed the. BMW 4 Series Gran Coupe.

snippet.title: BMW C1-E (2009) - BMW Motorcycle Magazine
snippet.description: BMW resurrects the C1 scooter with a roof (produced from 1999-2003) but removes the single-cylinder engine in favor of electric motors to create the C1-E. This concept, which is not scheduled to go into production, was created as part of the European Safer Urban Motorcycling (eSUM) project.

snippet.title: E is for electric - The BMW C1-E concept scooter - Image 1 of 13
snippet.description: BMW's C1-E scooter is designed for urban transport. BMW has brought back the C1 as an electric-powered concept scooter called the C1-E. The BMW C1-E concept scooter. Read Gizmag's latest product comparisons. Other Images from this Gallery.

snippet.title: BMW C1-E Scooter - Electric Concept - Ultimate MotorCycling
snippet.description: The safety features of the C1-E have been taken from the former BMW C1 and further enhanced BMW's avant-garde two-wheeler is regarded as a milestone in safety on two wheels. It is the only motorised single-track vehicle to be exempt from mandatory helmet wearing in almost all European countries.
